page.title: 11Wild life in Chelmsley Wood
page.content: Chelmsley Wood is mainly residential but it includes plenty of wildlife. You can find sparrows, housemartins, blackbirds and magpies. Insects of various kinds can also be traced. Wild rabbits, squirrels and hares are also common place. Rivers contain minnows and stickleback, frogs and dragonflies can be found in small streams. Pollution is a major problem and attempts to clean up the enviroment have been included in the project "Kingfisher".(a scheme involving schools and the local community to clean up the river Cole). Unfortunatly swans and ducks are still being killed by fishermens lead shot. Other forms of pollution include litter and carbon monoxide poisoning, the latter having disastrous effects on animal and human life alike.
